Why was the original punishment a chat restriction if he was flagged as an intentional feeder?

I presume the chat was the reason trolling was discovered. As he said, the system had to decide between showing the chat, or showing the game. The computer decided the post game chat of OP admitting to trolling would be more beneficial than the game itself, but the system forgot it doesn't display post game chat.

I'm sorry but this is the most absurd "explanation" I have ever seen. The system isn't advanced enough to determine that he is feeding intentionally just from those four lines, and the system doesn't even read or punish for pre and post game chat unless it's a manual review.  Also, the system wouldn't just """forget""" (??????) that post game chat isn't shown

Either you don't know how it works or are just making up some random nonsense to damage control for faults in the IFS.

1. The system does now punish for pre and post game chat.

2. The system could certainly look at the chat and game, and say "hmm, looks like feeding but I'm not certain enough to give a ban, so I'll just give a chat restriction".

3. The client is not able to display post game chat at this time. There is no reason to reprogram the IFS as this is a client issue. It flagged it as a chat violation because it was not certain enough to issue a feeding violation.

You forgot a comma?

It looks correct to me, comma-wise.

Now, irony is that he said "regarding the English grammar", instead of "English *language*". "The English grammar" is not a proper sentence. "The English language", or "(regarding) English grammar" would have been, but the "the" makes it incorrect according to standard conventions.
It could be that you were reported for toxicity in other games and this was the final game that you were reported for so they showed these logs.
But there's absolutely 0 reason to restrict chat for these logs. Even if he was reported for this game, no way this game contributed in the punishment.
